Key Arguments: The bill grants excessive power to ACMA, undermining freedom of speech and expression.
The legislation could lead Australia towards authoritarianism, similar to countries like China or North Korea.
The Australian Parliament may not have the constitutional authority to pass this bill.
There is skepticism about who determines what constitutes misinformation and disinformation.
Past government actions, particularly related to COVID-19, have been misleading, questioning the reliability of authorities.
